abstract: China Citic Bank plans to raise up to 30.14 billion Hong Kong dollars ($3.86 billion) in an initial public offering ahead of its Hong Kong listing on April 27, a news report said Tuesday. The indicative price range of the “H” shares – Hong Kong dollar-denominated shares of companies based in mainland China – is 4.72 Hong Kong dollars to 6.17 Hong Kong dollars each, according to a term sheet seen by Dow Jones Newswires.
lead_paragraph: China Citic Bank plans to raise up to 30.14 billion Hong Kong dollars ($3.86 billion) in an initial public offering ahead of its Hong Kong listing on April 27, a news report said Tuesday. The indicative price range of the “H” shares – Hong Kong dollar-denominated shares of companies based in mainland China – is 4.72 Hong Kong dollars to 6.17 Hong Kong dollars each, according to a term sheet seen by Dow Jones Newswires.

headline.main: China Citic Bank Looks to Raise $3.86 Billion in I.P.O.
